briefdescription.para: Read succeeded.
Some kind of error.
EOF returned.
Enumeration for status of a read()
Fixed "out of memory" error message, just to avoid making up a different string every time and wasting space.

memberdef.name: _dbus_return_if_fail_warning_format
memberdef.initializer: = "arguments to %s() were incorrect, assertion \"%s\" failed in file %s line %d.\n" "This is normally a bug in some application using the D-Bus library.\n"

briefdescription.para: String used in _dbus_return_if_fail macro.
Prints a warning message to stderr.

detaileddescription.para: Can optionally be made to exit fatally by setting DBUS_FATAL_WARNINGS, but this is rarely used. This function should be considered pretty much equivalent to fprintf(stderr). _dbus_warn_check_failed() on the other hand is suitable for use when a programming mistake has been made.

briefdescription.para: Prints a "critical" warning to stderr when an assertion fails; differs from _dbus_warn primarily in that it prefixes the pid and defaults to fatal.

detaileddescription.para: This should be used only when a programming error has been detected. (NOT for unavoidable errors that an app might handle - those should be returned as DBusError.) Calling this means "there is a bug"

briefdescription.para: Duplicates a string.

detaileddescription.para: Result must be freed with dbus_free(). Returns NULL if memory allocation fails. If the string to be duplicated is NULL, returns NULL.

briefdescription.para: Duplicates a block of memory.

detaileddescription.para: Returns NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Duplicates a string array.

detaileddescription.para: Result may be freed with dbus_free_string_array(). Returns NULL if memory allocation fails. If the array to be duplicated is NULL, returns NULL.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a string array contains the given string.
Generates a new UUID.

detaileddescription.para: If you change how this is done, there's some text about it in the spec that should also change.

briefdescription.para: Hex-encode a UUID.

parameterdescription.para: string to append hex uuid to

briefdescription.para: Write the give UUID to a file.
Reads (and optionally writes) a uuid to a file.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes the uuid unless an error is returned.

parameterdescription.para: uuid to be initialized with the loaded uuid
TRUE to create a new uuid and save it if the file doesn't exist

simplesect.para: FALSE if the error is set

briefdescription.para: Gets the hex-encoded UUID of the machine this function is executed on.

detaileddescription.para: This UUID is guaranteed to be the same for a given machine at least until it next reboots, though it also makes some effort to be the same forever, it may change if the machine is reconfigured or its hardware is modified.

parameterdescription.para: string to append hex-encoded machine uuid to

memberdef.argsstring: (dbus_bool_t condition, const char *condition_text, const char *file, int line, const char *func)
memberdef.name: _dbus_real_assert

briefdescription.para: Internals of _dbus_assert(); it's a function rather than a macro with the inline code so that the assertion failure blocks don't show up in test suite coverage, and to shrink code size.
Internals of _dbus_assert_not_reached(); it's a function rather than a macro with the inline code so that the assertion failure blocks don't show up in test suite coverage, and to shrink code size.

parameterdescription.para: what was reached that shouldn't have been

memberdef.argsstring: (int fd, int *buf, int n_ints_in_buf, int *n_ints_read, DBusError *error)
memberdef.name: read_ints

briefdescription.para: Increment the reference count on the babysitter object.
Decrement the reference count on the babysitter object.

detaileddescription.para: When the reference count of the babysitter object reaches zero, the babysitter is killed and the child that was being babysat gets emancipated.

briefdescription.para: Blocks until the babysitter process gives us the PID of the spawned grandchild, then kills the spawned grandchild.
Checks whether the child has exited, without blocking.
Gets the exit status of the child.

detaileddescription.para: We do this so implementation specific detail is not cluttering up dbus, for example the system launcher code. This can only be called if the child has exited, i.e. call _dbus_babysitter_get_child_exited(). It returns FALSE if the child did not return a status code, e.g. because the child was signaled or we failed to ever launch the child in the first place.

briefdescription.para: Sets the DBusError with an explanation of why the spawned child process exited (on a signal, or whatever).

detaileddescription.para: If the child process has not exited, does nothing (error will remain unset).

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusBabysitter *sitter, DBusAddWatchFunction add_function, DBusRemoveWatchFunction remove_function, DBusWatchToggledFunction toggled_function, void *data, DBusFreeFunction free_data_function)
memberdef.name: _dbus_babysitter_set_watch_functions

briefdescription.para: Sets watch functions to notify us when the babysitter object needs to read/write file descriptors.

parameterdescription.para: function to begin monitoring a new descriptor.
function to stop monitoring a descriptor.
function to notify when the watch is enabled/disabled
data to pass to add_function and remove_function.
function to be called to free the data.

memberdef.argsstring: (int child_err_report_fd, char **argv, char **envp, DBusSpawnChildSetupFunc child_setup, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: do_exec

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusBabysitter **sitter_p, const char *log_name, char **argv, char **env, DBusSpawnChildSetupFunc child_setup, void *user_data, DBusError *error)
memberdef.name: _dbus_spawn_async_with_babysitter

briefdescription.para: Spawns a new process.

detaileddescription.para: The child_setup function is passed the given user_data and is run in the child just before calling exec().

Also creates a "babysitter" which tracks the status of the child process, advising the parent if the child exits. If the spawn fails, no babysitter is created. If sitter_p is NULL, no babysitter is kept.

parameterdescription.para: return location for babysitter or NULL
the name under which to log messages about this process being spawned
the environment, or NULL to copy the parent's
function to call in child pre-exec()
error object to be filled in if function fails

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE if error is filled in

briefdescription.para: Does the chdir, fork, setsid, etc.

detaileddescription.para: to become a daemon process.

parameterdescription.para: pipe to print daemon's pid to, or -1 for none
TRUE to keep the original umask

briefdescription.para: Creates a file containing the process ID.
Writes the given pid_to_write to a pidfile (if non-NULL) and/or to a pipe (if non-NULL).

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing if pidfile and print_pid_pipe are both NULL.

parameterdescription.para: the file to write to or NULL
the pipe to write to or NULL

briefdescription.para: Verify that after the fork we can successfully change to this user.

parameterdescription.para: the username given in the daemon configuration

briefdescription.para: Changes the user and group the bus is running as.
Log a message to the system log file (e.g.

detaileddescription.para: syslog on Unix).

briefdescription.para: Log a message to the system log file (e.g.

detaileddescription.para: syslog on Unix).

severity
a severity value
msg
a printf-style format string
args
arguments for the format string
If the FATAL severity is given, this function will terminate the program with an error code.

briefdescription.para: Installs a UNIX signal handler.
Checks if a file exists.

detaileddescription.para: File interface.

briefdescription.para: Checks if user is at the console.

simplesect.para: TRUE is the user is at the consolei and there are no errors

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the filename is an absolute path.
stat() wrapper.

parameterdescription.para: the stat info to fill in

briefdescription.para: Open a directory to iterate over.

simplesect.para: new iterator, or NULL on error

briefdescription.para: Get next file in the directory.

detaileddescription.para: Will not return "." or ".." on UNIX. If an error occurs, the contents of "filename" are undefined. The error is never set if the function succeeds.
This function is not re-entrant, and not necessarily thread-safe. Only use it for test code or single-threaded utilities.

parameterdescription.para: string to be set to the next file in the dir

simplesect.para: TRUE if filename was filled in with a new filename

briefdescription.para: Closes a directory iteration.
Initializes the given DBusGroupInfo struct with information about the given group name.
Initializes the given DBusGroupInfo struct with information about the given group ID.
Parse a UNIX user from the bus config file.

detaileddescription.para: On Windows, this should simply always fail (just return FALSE).

briefdescription.para: Parse a UNIX group from the bus config file.

detaileddescription.para: On Windows, this should simply always fail (just return FALSE).

briefdescription.para: Gets all groups corresponding to the given UNIX user ID.

detaileddescription.para: On UNIX, just calls _dbus_groups_from_uid(). On Windows, should always fail since we don't know any UNIX groups.

parameterdescription.para: return location for array of group IDs
return location for length of returned array

simplesect.para: TRUE if the UID existed and we got some credentials

briefdescription.para: Checks to see if the UNIX user ID is at the console.

detaileddescription.para: Should always fail on Windows (set the error to DBUS_ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED).

simplesect.para: TRUE if the UID is the same as the console user and there are no errors

briefdescription.para: Checks to see if the UNIX user ID matches the UID of the process.

detaileddescription.para: Should always return FALSE on Windows.

simplesect.para: TRUE if this uid owns the process.

briefdescription.para: Checks to see if the Windows user SID matches the owner of the process.

detaileddescription.para: Should always return FALSE on UNIX.

simplesect.para: TRUE if this user owns the process.

briefdescription.para: Random numbers.
Fills n_bytes of the given buffer with random bytes.

parameterdescription.para: the number of bytes in buffer to write to

briefdescription.para: Generates the given number of random bytes, where the bytes are chosen from the alphanumeric ASCII subset.

parameterdescription.para: the number of random ASCII bytes to append to string

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE if no memory or other failure

briefdescription.para: Converts a UNIX errno, or Windows errno or WinSock error value into a DBusError name.

xrefdescription.para: should cover more errnos, specifically those from open().

briefdescription.para: Converts the current system errno value into a DBusError name.
Assign 0 to the global errno variable.
See if errno is ENOMEM.
See if errno is EINTR.
See if errno is EPIPE.
See if errno is ETOOMANYREFS.
Get error message from errno.
Checks to see if the UID sent in is the console user.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the UID is the same as the console user and there are no errors

briefdescription.para: Gets user ID given username.

simplesect.para: TRUE if username existed and we got the UID

briefdescription.para: Gets group ID given groupname.

simplesect.para: TRUE if group name existed and we got the GID

briefdescription.para: Gets user ID and primary group given username.

simplesect.para: TRUE if username existed and we got the UID and GID

briefdescription.para: Looks up a gid or group name in the user database.

detaileddescription.para: Only one of name or GID can be provided. There are wrapper functions for this that are better to use, this one does no locking or anything on the database and otherwise sort of sucks.

briefdescription.para: Gets the user information for the given group name, returned group info should not be freed.

parameterdescription.para: return location for const ref to group info

briefdescription.para: Gets the user information for the given GID, returned group info should not be freed.

parameterdescription.para: return location for const ref to group info

briefdescription.para: Gets all groups corresponding to the given UID.

detaileddescription.para: Returns FALSE if no memory, or user isn't known, but always initializes group_ids to a NULL array.

parameterdescription.para: return location for array of group IDs
return location for length of returned array

simplesect.para: TRUE if the UID existed and we got some credentials

briefdescription.para: Frees the given DBusUserInfo's members with _dbus_user_info_free() and also calls dbus_free() on the block itself.
Frees the given DBusGroupInfo's members with _dbus_group_info_free() and also calls dbus_free() on the block itself.
Frees the members of info (but not info itself)
Frees the members of info (but not info itself).
Checks if a given string is actually a number and converts it if it is.

briefdescription.para: Looks up a uid or username in the user database.

detaileddescription.para: Only one of name or UID can be provided. There are wrapper functions for this that are better to use, this one does no locking or anything on the database and otherwise sort of sucks.

briefdescription.para: Locks global system user database.
Unlocks global system user database.
Gets the system global user database; must be called with lock held (_dbus_user_database_lock_system()).

simplesect.para: the database or NULL if no memory

briefdescription.para: Flushes the system global user database;.
Gets username of user owning current process.

detaileddescription.para: The returned string is valid until dbus_shutdown() is called.

briefdescription.para: Gets homedir of user owning current process.

briefdescription.para: Gets the home directory for the given user.

parameterdescription.para: string to append home directory to

simplesect.para: TRUE if user existed and we appended their homedir

briefdescription.para: Adds the credentials corresponding to the given username.

detaileddescription.para: Used among other purposes to parses a desired identity provided from a client in the auth protocol. On UNIX this means parsing a UID, on Windows probably parsing an SID string.

xrefdescription.para: this is broken because it treats OOM and parse error the same way. Needs a DBusError.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the username existed and we got some credentials

briefdescription.para: Creates a new user database object used to look up and cache user information.

Decrements refcount of user database.

briefdescription.para: Gets the user information for the given username.

briefdescription.para: Aborts with an error message if the condition is false.
Aborts with an error message if called.

briefdescription.para: Computes the number of elements in a fixed-size array using sizeof().

parameterdescription.para: the array to count elements in.

briefdescription.para: Safely casts a void* to an integer; should only be used on void* that actually contain integers, for example one created with _DBUS_INT_TO_POINTER.

detaileddescription.para: Only guaranteed to preserve 32 bits. (i.e. it's used to store 32-bit ints in pointers, but can't be used to store 64-bit pointers in ints.)

parameterdescription.para: pointer to extract an integer from.

briefdescription.para: Safely stuffs an integer into a pointer, to be extracted later with _DBUS_POINTER_TO_INT.

detaileddescription.para: Only guaranteed to preserve 32 bits.

parameterdescription.para: the integer to stuff into a pointer.

Macro returns TRUE if the babysitter still has live sockets open to the babysitter child or the grandchild.

Helps remember which end of the pipe is which.
Used to iterate over each item in a collection, such as a DBusList.
